file_content.text: I've seen to it that word of your deeds is spreading. Soon every planet will learn the price of defiance.
My scouts have reported that you have exceeded even my own high expectations.
I will make certain that word of this slaughter is spread throughout the galaxy. Soon none will dare oppose us.
This massacre only whetted my appetite for more.
How else may I serve you?
While I would not deny your zeal, I will be busy spreading word of your victory.
That wasn't warfare, it was butchery. I should never have agreed.
I regret helping you.
Your squeamishness is a surprising but natural response. Once you see how you have helped us, you will recover.
You cut the very heart out of the resistance. It is the only possible outcome for those who dare oppose the Empire.
My skills were wasted on this.
Your inability to see the impact of your actions does not concern me. It is not the tool's job to understand the mind of the craftsman.
Your enthusiasm for attacking the Republic's troops is laudable, but the artillery must also be destroyed.
The artillery is of important strategic value--but everyone in the hotel must die. The galaxy must learn the price of defiance.
I have scouts to give me status reports. Contact me when you are finished.
I am Lord Malichose. We met on Alderaan once. Your...innovative work fomenting strife there has become standard practice.
Your talents at influencing a population might be similarly useful here.
I am Lord Malichose. I have heard of your strength in the Force. Your skills could serve the Empire perfectly.
I am Lord Malichose. My sources have told me much about your capabilities, and the Empire has need of you.
I am Lord Malichose. Your service to the Empire has been admirable--but we require more.
Darth Decimus summoned me because he is concerned about the progress of this occupation.
The resistance has continued too long. If Corellia is not brought to heel quickly, other planets may follow her example.
Only force will crush these insurgents.
We've been too soft on them.
Indeed. The problem arises in their perceptions--they view not surrendering as equal to winning.
This resistance must learn that the will of the Empire is absolute.
They cling to hope like fools.
They fight a different war. They believe that not surrendering is winning.
Say the word, I am yours to command.
How may I serve you, my lord?
Name the target, I'll take care of it. For the proper payment.
Tell me what you want done.
Follow my orders, and your name will be on the lips of millions.
It's tough to dislodge an enemy when he's got nowhere left to run.
They're defending their homes.
That sort of sympathetic thinking is responsible for this situation in the first place.
Corellia's not my problem.
I will not allow your apathy to undermine the Empire.
It is not enough to defeat the resistance in battle. We must snuff out their last flicker of hope.
The encampment in the Coronet Arms Hotel has become a symbol of the uprising. Losing the hotel would gut this pathetic rebellion.
I would have expected a target with more strategic value
Why attack a hotel?
The Republic has placed artillery within and refuses to abandon it.
If we aren't careful, it could make the resistance more determined than before.
Symbols are difficult to break.
That is why we must break them utterly and without remorse.
Is there a way to break them?
The soldiers held the hotel through multiple bombardments and repelled two charges. They are now celebrated as heroes across the planet.
Kill them all. Let the resistance see the true price of defying the Empire.
If it serves the goals of the Empire, I can do it.
I consider it my duty.
Your loyalty is unquestioned. While you are within the hotel, the Empire needs one additional service from you.
I will break their pathetic resistance, without mercy.
There will be no survivors.
Your zeal for bloodshed is admirable.
You must disable the Republic artillery as well. We cannot risk them returning to the hotel and using it again.
Leave none alive, be as...creative as you like. The word will spread quickly and Corellia will weep.
There's a difference between military action and committing war crimes.
I won't. [Refuse quest]
Only to those who foolishly maintain that war can be civil. No matter, I will find someone more dedicated to our cause.
This occupation has been handled too softly. A population does not respect what they do not also fear.
